info.name: vRealize Operations REST API Examples
info.description:
**Description**

A collection of vRealize Operations REST APIs organized by use case.  This collection is updated frequently and typically using the latest release of vRealize Operations.

Also now include are some examples for deploying a new vRealize Operations cluster using the CASA API.  CASA stands for Cluster and Slice Administration.  This API allows you to install and manage your cluster. 

Authorization for the REST APIs are handled via OAuth and an API call is included that will request and store a token for the other REST calls.  Be sure to set the included variables for your env.  Basic auth is only used by the REST API "Run First" call.

Authentication for CASA uses basic and you will also need to get the master node thumbprint for some of these workflows.

Also, many of the REST calls have tests, which store additional information as part of a workflow.  Be sure to set headers to send/rec payloads in JSON format, as the tests assume this format.  Default for vROps API is XML so any post-tests will fail and any pre-tests provide env vars in JSON format.

**Documentation**

Documentation for the APIs can be found on the vROps appliance:

/suite-api for the REST APIs
/casa/api-guide.html for the CASA REST APIs

**Contributors:**

John Dias, diasj@vmware.com
Chris McClanahan, mcclanahanc@vmware.com

Add Child Resource to a Resource

request.description:
This operation adds a child resource to a resource.  

API documentation states that POST is additive while PUT is destructive (i.e. overwites existing relationships).

JSON body includes an array of child objects to add.  

The call does not provide a lot of detail for failure, but it seems
that if you have an invalid UUID for a child or the child is already related
then it will fail with 400.

204 is a successful call.
Gets all - to get a single report ID, just add /<report def id>

You will need to update several items in the body such as:
  - ID of resource you wish to run this report on
  - ID of the report you wish to run
  - Traversal Spec for the report (you can get this from the API query
"Get Report Definitions", the travesal spec must match the resource type.

You can check status of report runs this way.
To get a specific generated report add /<report id>

item.name: Get StatKeys for Resource and Load var

request.description:
Grabs CPU statKeys for a VM resource using the {{resourceId}} env var.
Populates two env vars:
cpuStatKeys for GET stats for small requests (1 to ~10 VMs)
cpuStatKeysJSON for POST stats for large requests (use in conjunction with {{resourceIds}}
